summary: The implementation successfully delivers all 8 requirements for the Service Activation Modal. The modal is self-contained using React state and Tailwind CSS, includes all required form fields with exact mock data values, implements reactive calculations with proper formatting, provides comprehensive form validation, and maintains a clean, professional design. All acceptance criteria appear to be met based on the visible code.

hallucinated_features.description: Console.log debugging statement in handleSubmit that logs form data
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest did not specify logging form submission data to console. The TODO comment was required but not additional debugging logic.

hallucinated_features.description: Form reset logic in useEffect that clears all fields when modal closes
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest did not explicitly require resetting form state when the modal closes. This is reasonable defensive programming but was not specified.

hallucinated_features.description: Close icon (X from lucide-react) in modal header
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest did not specify a close button in the header. Only the Batal button was required for closing the modal.

hallucinated_features.description: Modal title Aktivasi Layanan Baru in header
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest did not specify a modal title or header text. While reasonable for UX, it was not explicitly requested.

hallucinated_features.description: Aktivasi Layanan button in InternalDashboard with Plus icon
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest focused solely on creating the modal component itself. Integration into InternalDashboard with a trigger button was not specified.

hallucinated_features.description: Role-based visibility check (canActivateService) for the activation button
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest explicitly listed in Non-goals: Adding role-based access control to the modal component itself. While this is on the parent component, the requirement was to create the modal, not integrate access control.
